title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
Hello gents. This board came in with no power. No sign of liquid spill or corrosion. All i'm getting is 5V on PP20V_USBC and the below measurements. 

PPBUS_G3H - 0.090
PPBUS_HS_CPU - 0.090
PPBUS_HS_OTH5V - 0.090

PP3V3_G3H - 3.4 but pulses down to about 0.2v then back up to 3.4. same wit PP3V3_G3H_SMC.

Any suggestions on where next to check. I'm still getting familiar with the 2016 up boards.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
"5V on PP20V_USBC"
Stable 5V, not pulsing?
Same on all USB-C ports?

R7020 voltage pulsing?
Diode mode to ground at F7000?
And what about BUF_SMC_RESET_L?

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
PP20V_USBC is also pulsing down to 0.
Yes all USB-C ports, R7090 are pulsing 5 to 0. 

Diode mode to ground at F7000 - 0.43
BUF_SMC_RESET_L also pulsing 0 to 3.4

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: Very very likely you have a bad CD3215. Diode mode all 3.3 1.8 inputs for each CD3215. A trick I like sometimes is injecting 3.3 volts into PP3v3_G3H to see if there is any current draw. If so, usually it?s one of the CD3215s

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO - 0.496
PP3V3_G3H - 0.33
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC - 0.49
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD - 0.47
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA - 0.5

Above values pretty much the same on all 4 chips.

Injected 3.3 on PP3v3_G3H, resulted in a current draw of 44mA.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: Yeah so realistically could be any of the CD3215s causing your issue.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
Remove R7020 and D6902; one by one.
Still pulsing?

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
Sorry for the late response. I've been out of town. 

So i removed R7020 and D6902. The pulsing on PP20V_USBC has stopped. 

I'm also still waiting on a couple CD3215 chips to arrive.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: If one USB-C still has 5V only, corresponding CD3215 is the first suspect.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
So i put all the components back in and noticed, F3000 is the only fuse that doesn't pulse and stay at 5v. So FB201, FB200 and F3001 all pulse when i power their usb-c ports.

Does this mean the 3 CD3215 are all bad?

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
"If one USB-C still has 5V only"
I was thinking you check w/o R7020 and D6902...

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: Still 5v on F300 without R7020 and D6902.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: All USB-C same, or just one port?

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: With R7020 and D6902 removes, all USB-C are steady 5v.  Once R70920 and D6902 are reinstalled, only F3000 has a non-pulsing 5v.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: Start changing CD3215 from the port with different symptom.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: After changing the CD3215 from the port that was steady, the pulsing stopped. But still only getting steady 5v on all ports now. Wondering if these chips I got from China are any good. Thought I would save some money but I?m going to buy some locally to confirm that the chips are DOA.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
CD3215 chips have firmware.
You need the same termination code; i.e. B03, or C00...

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: Yeah. I installed one identical to the one pulled; cd3215c00.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: Replaced U3200 and U3100. Board now powers up. This is now fixed. Thanks gents.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message:
These new boards make us crazy.
I saw people reporting working boards on 2 from 4 USB-C ports.
So we never can confirm 100% which should be the state of all 4 ports.

title: 820-00239 - Not Powering up. PP20V_USBC 5.19V
message: Yeah I relay do not like these boards.
